title: Intern - AI Solutions Engineer
description:
As an AI Solutions Engineer Intern, you will work closely with the Strategy / CEO's Office to build AI-first automations and agentic workflows that remove manual work and strengthen operational reliability across Finance, Operations, GTM/Sales, Marketing, and Support.

This role is designed for someone who can identify high-impact automation opportunities, prototype quickly, and ship workflows that are production-ready, measurable, and scalable - with strong monitoring, guardrails, and maker-checker processes.

What You'll Own:
- Identify and scope high-leverage problems by quantifying baseline time spent, error rates, and defining success metrics
- Build and ship AI-powered automations (LLMs + rules + human-in-the-loop) with retries, alerts, audit trails, and approvals
- Integrate systems via APIs and webhooks across CRM, support desk, billing/finance tools, data warehouse, Slack/Email, and internal databases
- Instrument workflows with logging, dashboards, fallbacks, rollbacks, and post-launch QA to ensure reliability
- Create documentation including playbooks/runbooks and enable internal owners through training so workflows sustain long-term

Why This Role Matters:
Your work will drive measurable operational efficiency and reduce manual dependencies across key teams. You will build real-world AI systems that impact business outcomes, with the freedom to experiment, ship fast, and scale solutions across functions.

=== Requirements ===
‚Ä¢ Hands-on experience with automation platforms like Zapier, n8n, Make, or Pipedream (MUST HAVE)
‚Ä¢ Real workflows shipped end-to-end (MUST HAVE)
‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of APIs and webhooks (REST, OAuth2, JSON) (MUST HAVE)
‚Ä¢ Comfortable using Postman/Insomnia (MUST HAVE)
‚Ä¢ Strong fundamentals in LLMs: prompting, tool/function calling, grounding/RAG basics, PII/safety hygiene (MUST HAVE)
‚Ä¢ Comfortable scripting in Python or JavaScript for utilities and workflow extensions (MUST HAVE)
‚Ä¢ Strong basics of SQL/spreadsheets (MUST HAVE)
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with idempotency, error handling, retry patterns, and queue-based workflows (MUST HAVE)
‚Ä¢ Strong operator mindset - map processes, stakeholder discovery, crisp documentation, track KPIs (MUST HAVE)
‚Ä¢ Bonus: Prior startup internship in Ops/RevOps/Support/Finance/GTM
‚Ä¢ Bonus: Portfolio of shipped automation projects

=== Benefits ===
‚Ä¢ Direct exposure to CEO's Office
‚Ä¢ High-ownership role
‚Ä¢ Work with 15,000+ merchants
‚Ä¢ Enable $2B+ in GMV annually
‚Ä¢ $68M total funding (RTP Global, Z47, Peak XV, Think Investments)
‚Ä¢ $13M raised in June 2025
‚Ä¢ Scaling across India, UK, Europe, and US
‚Ä¢ Build real-world AI systems

title: Agentic AI Engineering Intern
description:
This isn't just a standard engineering internship - it's an opportunity to define the future of work within a high-growth startup. We are looking for a technical builder to serve as a force multiplier for our entire organization, from Engineering to Sales, and Recruiting to Customer Success.

As our Agentic AI Engineering Intern, you will not be spending your days fixing minor bugs. Instead, you will architect and deploy the internal automation engine that fuels our company. Your mandate is to build high-impact internal tools and workflows that allow our team to operate at exceptional speed.

Crucially, this role requires a '100x' mindset. You will be required to move beyond traditional coding methods by strictly leveraging low-code orchestration tools (n8n) and Agentic AI (Claude Cowork, Claude Code, OpenAI Codex) to deliver solutions exponentially faster than standard development cycles. You will operate at the intersection of technical logic and AI orchestration to build the 'nervous system' of a modern tech startup.

Responsibilities:
- Workflow Architecture: Design and build complex automation workflows using n8n to connect internal ecosystem (CRM, ATS, ERP, and Engineering tools)
- AI Agent Deployment: Leverage Agentic AI (Claude for Work, LLMs) to handle complex logic, code generation, and data analysis, minimizing manual coding time
- Cross-Functional Tooling: Collaborate directly with Founders, Sales, and Engineering leaders to identify operational bottlenecks and deploy immediate technical solutions
- Rapid Prototyping: Accelerate development lifecycle by moving from idea to deployed internal tool in hours, not weeks
- System Optimization: Monitor and refine automated processes to ensure reliability and scalability

Duration: 3-6 months intensive internship. High performers may be considered for extended opportunities.

=== Requirements ===
‚Ä¢ 0-3 years in technical field (Software Engineering, AI, Computer Science, or similar) (MUST HAVE)
‚Ä¢ The '100x' Mindset - obsessed with efficiency, prioritize orchestration and leverage over manual execution (MUST HAVE)
‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of APIs, Webhooks, JSON, and logic flow (MUST HAVE)
‚Ä¢ Python or JavaScript experience for custom logic implementation (MUST HAVE)
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with workflow orchestration tools like n8n (or intense drive to master) (MUST HAVE)
‚Ä¢ Experience with AI collaboration suites like Claude Projects (or drive to learn) (MUST HAVE)
‚Ä¢ English fluency required (MUST HAVE)
‚Ä¢ Willing to engage across functions to align with stakeholders
‚Ä¢ Seek to automate any repetitive task
‚Ä¢ Optional: Willing to spend few weeks on-site in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

=== Benefits ===
‚Ä¢ 100% Remote work
‚Ä¢ Work with clients like Tesla and Coca-Cola supply chains
‚Ä¢ Backed by legendary VCs (Flexport, Databricks, Perplexity investors)
‚Ä¢ Master the future of engineering - Architect of Intelligence
‚Ä¢ Move beyond syntax - learn AI orchestration

title: Frontend Engineer (React)

title: Web Software Developer
description:
Responsibilities

Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and enhance internet and intranet properties, including websites, web portals, web applications, mobile websites, digital channels, widgets, and related components. 
Support and maintain web content management systems, web analytics services, graphical user interfaces, data visualization interfaces, and supporting multimedia and cloud based technologies. 
Build, deploy, and update websites and content modules using approved CDC WordPress templates and frameworks. 
Configure websites and components (navigation, headers, footers, templates, and layouts) in accordance with CDC web policies, standards, and best practices. 
Provide technical support for public health surveillance projects and initiatives, including development and dissemination of data, program materials, and analytical content. 
Develop and support secure, robust IT solutions such as web applications, electronic surveys, analytical components, reporting tools, microservices, APIs, and cloud based solutions. 
Perform quality assurance testing, cross browser testing, and validation to ensure functionality, usability, security, and compliance prior to submission for CDC review and clearance. 
Analyze web metrics and performance data to improve search engine optimization (SEO), site architecture, usability, and overall website performance. 
Identify and resolve operational issues such as broken links, missing assets, formatting errors, and performance problems across web and social media platforms. 
Ensure all digital properties comply with Section 508 accessibility requirements, health literacy standards, responsive web design principles, and Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG). 
Perform accessibility scans, remediate non compliant issues, and optimize images, PDFs, and other digital assets using appropriate tools (e.g., Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, Acrobat Pro). 
Ensure compliance with CDC IT security policies and standards, including safeguards to protect sensitive data and personally identifiable information (PII).
Collaborate with CDC information security officers and technical stakeholders as needed to support secure system design and operation. 
Provide expert technical recommendations to senior managers, subject matter experts, and program owners on emerging web, mobile, and digital technologies.
Migrate legacy content to new templates or platforms and support template upgrades and modernization efforts. 
Support the dissemination and extended use of public health information by maintaining and enhancing HTML and WordPress based web resources in alignment with federal and CDC digital guidelines. 
Participate in CDC workgroups, meetings, and advisory forums related to web, digital media and technology

=== Requirements ===
‚Ä¢ Minimum of 2 years of professional web development experience delivering production websites/web apps for a federal government agency.
‚Ä¢ Proficiency with web technologies such as HTML, XHTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, CMS platforms, and responsive design frameworks.
‚Ä¢ Experience with web accessibility (Section 508), SEO, web analytics, and cross-browser testing.
‚Ä¢ Collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to work across technical and non-technical teams.
‚Ä¢ Proficiency with WordPress site building and using standardized templates/modules.
‚Ä¢ Strong experience with QA/testing workflows, including cross-browser testing and pre-release validation.
‚Ä¢ Working knowledge of Adobe Acrobat for PDF remediation.
‚Ä¢ Working knowledge of secure web development and implementing sites consistent with security and privacy requirements.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of CDC digital policies, security requirements, and clearance processes.
‚Ä¢ Ability to pass required Federal background screening, obtain and maintain government clearance.
‚Ä¢ Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future.

=== Benefits ===
‚Ä¢ Competitive salary and performance bonuses
‚Ä¢ Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance
‚Ä¢ 401(k) with company match
‚Ä¢ Flexible work arrangements (remote/hybrid options)
‚Ä¢ Professional development and training
‚Ä¢ Paid time off and holidays
‚Ä¢ Employee wellness programs
‚Ä¢ Collaborative and inclusive culture
‚Ä¢ Career advancement opportunities

This position requires an initiative-taking, multitasking and creative individual who is excited about learning and developing solid solutions for the organization's next generation web platforms. You will collaborate with departmental leaders to translate complex business initiatives into innovative solutions.

title: Data Analyst
description:
We are seeking a Data Analyst to design, build, and maintain secure, scalable data pipelines that enable effective use of enterprise data. In this role, you'll collaborate with engineers, analysts, and data stewards to deliver reliable datasets and models that support analytics, reporting, and decision-making.

You'll support enterprise intelligence and data solutions by analyzing, curating, and transforming complex datasets to enable informed decision-making across a diverse federal health and readiness data ecosystem. Working closely with technical teams and stakeholders, you'll help translate raw data into actionable insights, dashboards, and analytical outputs that support mission outcomes.

Key Responsibilities:
- Analyze large, complex datasets in enterprise or government environments
- Contribute to data quality efforts and assist with integration validation
- Help ensure data products are reliable, usable, and aligned with operational needs
- Collaborate with engineers, data architects, and stakeholders
- Work across multiple data sources, systems, or domains
- Present findings clearly to technical and non-technical audiences
- Support Military Health and related federal domains

=== Requirements ===
‚Ä¢ Bachelor's Degree required
‚Ä¢ Experience analyzing large, complex datasets in enterprise or government environments
‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of data quality, validation, and analytical best practices
‚Ä¢ Ability to translate business or mission questions into data-driven insights
‚Ä¢ Experience collaborating with engineers, data architects, and stakeholders
‚Ä¢ Comfort working across multiple data sources, systems, or domains
‚Ä¢ Strong communication skills and ability to present findings clearly
‚Ä¢ Exposure to machine learning pipelines or advanced analytics integration (preferred)
‚Ä¢ Prior experience supporting DHA or other federal healthcare programs (preferred)
‚Ä¢ Must be authorized to work in the United States
‚Ä¢ Ability to obtain and maintain a federal background investigation and/or security clearance may be required

=== Benefits ===
‚Ä¢ Fully remote work arrangement
‚Ä¢ Tech & Education Stipend
‚Ä¢ Comprehensive Benefits Package
‚Ä¢ Company Match 401(k) plan
‚Ä¢ Flexible PTO
‚Ä¢ Paid Holidays
‚Ä¢ Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity and inclusion

title: Data Entry Clerk
description:

- Use custom tools to identify the advertiser funding specific social media accounts
- Identify the exact product being marketed in online display and video advertisements
- Write logic statements to search for and classify creatives (no computer language skills required)
- Suggest improvements to data quality by identifying erroneously categorized creatives

IMPORTANT NOTE: Fluency in at least one of the following languages is REQUIRED: Italian, Swedish, Norwegian, Finnish, Danish, Hungarian (Magyar), Lithuanian, Romanian, Greek, Hebrew (Israeli), Urdu, or Cantonese.

This job is extremely repetitive in nature and requires comfort with highly repetitive tasks.

‚Ä¢ Understanding of hierarchies and ability to create logical brand structures
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with advertising verticals
‚Ä¢ Flexibility and capacity to learn quickly

‚Ä¢ Ability to comfortably and repeatedly enter text without error
‚Ä¢ Self-motivation to complete assignments within established deadlines
‚Ä¢ High-speed internet connection required
‚Ä¢ Comfortable with highly repetitive tasks

=== Benefits ===

‚Ä¢ Remote training provided
‚Ä¢ Flexible daily schedule (complete work anytime within 8-hour limit)
‚Ä¢ Hourly compensation at $18/hour

title: Web Engineer
description:
AGBO is seeking a Web Engineer to join our Innovation team to help build and support digital experiences across our projects. This is a hands-on role for a developer who thrives in creative environments, enjoys solving complex technical problems, and can bring elegant, scalable solutions to life in the browser.

You'll work across a range of projects and this role is ideal for someone who balances performance, polish, and flexibility, and who's excited to collaborate with artists and strategists.

Key Responsibilities:

- Work closely with designers and creative leads to implement UI/UX that aligns with AGBO's brand and creative goals
- Build reusable components and design systems using modern frameworks (React, Vue, Svelte, etc.)

‚Ä¢ Hands-on experience with GraphQL is a significant plus

title: Business Analyst
description:
The Business Systems team defines and builds the business IT architecture that supports the commercial operation of Waymo's autonomous fleet. The team stands at the intersection of finance, operations and IT; through creative architecture, expertise and attention to detail, it ensures that Waymo has world-class capabilities across all its business processes.

Key Responsibilities:
- Act as a subject matter expert in SAP FICO modules, BRIM, RAR, Group Reporting, and Planning/Consolidation modules
- Collaborate with Finance, Accounting, and other cross-functional business stakeholders to elicit, analyze, validate, and document detailed business requirements
- Design, configure, test, and implement robust SAP solutions, ensuring alignment with best practices and regulatory compliance
- Lead and manage end-to-end implementation and enhancement projects
- Ensure the integrity of financial data across systems
- Provide tier 3 operational support and develop comprehensive training materials for end-users

=== Requirements ===
‚Ä¢ Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Information Technology, or related field
‚Ä¢ Minimum of 10+ years of experience working as a Business Analyst or Consultant with primary focus on SAP FICO
‚Ä¢ Proven experience in at least two full life cycle SAP implementation projects
‚Ä¢ Deep Functional Expertise in SAP FICO: General Ledger (GL), Accounts Payable (AP), Accounts Receivable (AR), Asset Accounting (AA)
‚Ä¢ SAP BRIM/Subscription Billing: Strong understanding of recurring revenue models, contract management, usage metering
‚Ä¢ SAP RAR: Hands-on experience with Revenue Accounting and Reporting module, IFRS 15/ASC 606 compliance
‚Ä¢ SAP Group Reporting (S/4HANA) / EC-CS: Experience with legal and management consolidation processes
‚Ä¢ SAP Planning & Consolidation (BPC) / SAC Planning: Proficiency in financial budgeting, forecasting, and planning
‚Ä¢ Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills

=== Benefits ===
‚Ä¢ Competitive base salary ($196,000 - $248,000)
‚Ä¢ Discretionary annual bonus program
‚Ä¢ Equity incentive plan
‚Ä¢ Top-notch medical, dental and vision insurance
‚Ä¢ Mental wellness support and gym membership
‚Ä¢ Flexible work arrangements (hybrid/remote options)
‚Ä¢ 26 weeks of paid leave for birthing parents
‚Ä¢ 18 weeks of paid leave for non-birthing parents
‚Ä¢ Education reimbursement and professional development
‚Ä¢ Access to Google offices, cafes, wellness centers

title: PHP Web Application Developer
description:
In this role you will embark on a large-scale, multi-year modernization initiative to transform a legacy monolithic PHP application into a modern, microservice-oriented architecture hosted on AWS. Your role as a Web Developer will bring deep experience in API-driven development, AWS cloud infrastructure, and modern DevOps practices to help drive this transformation.

You'll play a key role in decoupling business domains, architecting, implementing, and maintaining new microservices using Symfony/Doctrine or similar frameworks. Your focus will be on delivering high-quality, secure, and scalable API integrations.

Key Responsibilities:
- Have strong presence in the decoupling of the existing PHP monolith into domain-driven microservices and APIs
- Design, develop, and maintain back-end services using Symfony (or equivalent MVC frameworks) and Doctrine ORM
- Architect and implement RESTful APIs and ensure consistent documentation, testing, and versioning practices
- Build and consume third-party APIs, ensuring performance, scalability, and security best practices
- Collaborate closely with DevOps and Infrastructure teams to design cloud-native solutions using AWS services
- Containerize applications using Docker and manage orchestration via Kubernetes/ECS
- Implement and maintain CI/CD pipelines to support rapid, reliable deployments

=== Requirements ===
‚Ä¢ 0+ years of professional experience in back-end development with PHP (Symfony preferred)
‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of microservice architecture and API-first design principles
‚Ä¢ Proven experience deploying and managing applications on AWS (ECS, EKS, Lambda, API Gateway, RDS, CloudWatch, etc.)
‚Ä¢ Proficiency with Docker and Kubernetes (EKS or equivalent) for containerized deployments
‚Ä¢ Hands-on experience with CI/CD pipelines (GitHub Actions, Jenkins, GitLab CI, or AWS CodePipeline)
‚Ä¢ Experience using Infrastructure-as-Code tools such as Terraform or AWS CloudFormation
‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of third-party API integration patterns, rate limiting, and error handling
‚Ä¢ Experience working within an Agile/Scrum environment
‚Ä¢ YOU MUST RESIDE IN FL or TX (required)

=== Benefits ===
‚Ä¢ Medical, Dental & Vision insurance
‚Ä¢ 401k Match
‚Ä¢ Short Term Disability, Long Term Disability (Company Paid)
‚Ä¢ Company Paid Basic Life and AD&D
‚Ä¢ Flexible Work Arrangements (Remote)
‚Ä¢ 3 Weeks of PTO + 5 Personal Days
‚Ä¢ Paid Holiday Break from Christmas to New Year
‚Ä¢ Paid Holidays
‚Ä¢ Fitness Reimbursement Program
‚Ä¢ Annual Day of Giving
‚Ä¢ $1000 per year in Tickets-At-Work gift cards

title: Data Analyst
description:
As a Data Analyst, you will be part of a team responsible for owning and simplifying the flow of data used by production trading algorithms at Voleon. The primary responsibility is to ensure continuous operation of production-critical systems by leveraging an on-call rotation. When not taking part in this rotation, your work will focus on improvements to data-consumption pipelines.

Key Responsibilities:
- Share an on-call rotation; act as first responder ensuring the health and continuous operation of production-critical systems
- Perform manual steps and develop automated processes to ensure the completeness and integrity of massive amounts of mission critical financial data
- Partner with research staff to curate and onboard new and existing datasets
- Drive continuous improvements to data quality procedures and establish consistent measurement and reporting

=== Requirements ===
‚Ä¢ 0+ years of experience in data analysis or related field
‚Ä¢ Strong programming skills in Python or R
‚Ä¢ Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of SQL and database management
‚Ä¢ Understanding of statistical analysis and data quality procedures
‚Ä¢ Ability to work in on-call rotation for production systems
‚Ä¢ Strong problem-solving and communication skills

=== Benefits ===
‚Ä¢ Competitive compensation and benefits packages
‚Ä¢ Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, and life insurance
‚Ä¢ 401(k) with company match
‚Ä¢ Technology talks by industry experts
‚Ä¢ Modern office with catered lunches
‚Ä¢ Enriching and collaborative work environment
‚Ä¢ Referral bonus program up to $7,500

Work remotely for an Australian Transport & Logistics company, handling data entry tasks to support their operations. This role involves accurate data input, organization, and maintenance of transport and logistics information.

Key Responsibilities:
- Input and update transport and logistics data into systems
- Maintain accurate records of shipments, deliveries, and inventory
- Process documentation related to transport operations
- Verify data accuracy and completeness
- Organize digital files and databases
- Generate reports as needed
- Support administrative tasks for logistics operations
- Communicate with Australian team during business hours

=== Requirements ===
‚Ä¢ Strong attention to detail and accuracy
‚Ä¢ Good typing speed and computer skills
‚Ä¢ Proficiency in MS Office (Excel, Word)
‚Ä¢ Excellent English communication skills
‚Ä¢ Reliable internet connection and home office setup
‚Ä¢ Ability to work Australian business hours
‚Ä¢ Previous data entry experience preferred
‚Ä¢ Located in the Philippines

=== Benefits ===
‚Ä¢ Work from home
‚Ä¢ Stable Australian client
‚Ä¢ Professional development opportunities
‚Ä¢ Supportive management
‚Ä¢ Long-term employment potential
‚Ä¢ Training provided

title: Senior Sales Development Representative
description:
Drive revenue by selling cutting-edge services in Technology, SaaS, and AI solutions to B2B clients across the United States. Take full ownership of the sales cycle from prospecting to closing deals.

Key Responsibilities:
- Own the full sales cycle from prospecting to closing
- Generate leads through multichannel outreach (cold calling, email, LinkedIn)
- Conduct discovery calls and needs analysis
- Present and pitch LevelUp's BPO services to decision-makers
- Build and maintain a strong sales pipeline
- Meet and exceed monthly sales quotas
- Collaborate with internal teams for seamless client onboarding
- Stay updated on Technology, SaaS, and AI industry trends

=== Requirements ===
‚Ä¢ 3-5 years of proven B2B sales experience
‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of Technology, SaaS, or AI solutions
‚Ä¢ Excellent verbal and written English communication
‚Ä¢ Proven track record of meeting/exceeding sales targets
‚Ä¢ Self-starter with ability to work independently
‚Ä¢ Experience selling to US clients preferred
‚Ä¢ Comfortable with graveyard shift (12AM - 9AM)
‚Ä¢ Fluent in American English

=== Benefits ===
‚Ä¢ HMO coverage
‚Ä¢ Work remotely from Philippines
‚Ä¢ Career growth opportunities
‚Ä¢ Supportive team environment
‚Ä¢ Training and development
‚Ä¢ Competitive compensation package

title: Data Annotator - English Transcription (Brazilian Portuguese)
description:
Contribute to cutting-edge AI projects through data annotation and English transcription work. This is a flexible gig work opportunity for individuals who want to earn while working on AI training projects.

Key Responsibilities:
- Annotate and label data according to project guidelines
- Transcribe English audio to text
- Work with Brazilian Portuguese context
- Review annotated data for accuracy and completeness

title: Web Developer
description:
Administer, support, and develop websites for numerous nonprofit clients. Implement custom plugins, modify templates, and collaborate with project managers, designers, and developers to ensure successful project completion.

Key Responsibilities:

- Implement requested features ensuring seamless functionality

title: ASAALT STRI - Business Data Analyst
description:
Provide data analytics support to the PEO STRI office within the Assistant Secretary of the Army for Acquisition, Logistics and Technology (ASA(ALT)). Collaborate with senior leadership on data extraction, cleansing, analysis, visualization, and storytelling.

Key Responsibilities:
- Gather business requirements and analyze source systems
- Define data sources and transformation requirements
- Design data models and develop metadata for analysis
- Acquire and analyze data across the enterprise
- Create reports, charts, and dashboards
- Serve as functional and technical BI subject matter expert
- Translate business needs into prototypes and dashboard concepts
- Document data acquisition and governance processes
- Make process improvements and efficiencies
- Create training materials and conduct user training sessions

=== Requirements ===
‚Ä¢ Minimum 5 years of experience in business management
‚Ä¢ Minimum 2 years of experience in DoD cost, budget, scheduling or acquisition
‚Ä¢ Minimum 3 years of experience with Qlik Sense or Qlik View
‚Ä¢ Bachelor's degree in relevant field (or 7+ years experience in lieu of degree)
‚Ä¢ Experience with Tableau or Power BI preferred
‚Ä¢ Army experience preferred
‚Ä¢ Federal background investigation clearance required

=== Benefits ===
‚Ä¢ Employer paid health, dental, vision insurance
‚Ä¢ Disability, AD&D and life insurance
‚Ä¢ Flexible spending accounts
‚Ä¢ 11 paid holidays
‚Ä¢ 3 weeks PTO starting
‚Ä¢ 401(k) safe harbor contribution
‚Ä¢ Employee referral bonuses
‚Ä¢ Remote work flexibility

title: Data Analyst (ML/AI Focus)
description:
Develop and deploy ML/AI algorithms to build/implement predictive models about ATB clients and optimize team or organizational decision making. Focus on the Dual Risk Rating Project including implementation/development of Moody's portfolio studio for stress testing purposes.

Key Responsibilities:
- Develop and deploy ML/AI algorithms to build predictive models about ATB clients
- Write code and build data pipelines
- Research analytics techniques and understand business processes
- Work with external vendors at Moody's Analytics on primary model development
- Implement/develop Moody's portfolio studio for stress testing
- Focus on downstream impacts of the Dual Risk Rating Project
- Optimize team and organizational decision making through data science

=== Requirements ===
‚Ä¢ Strong coding skills in SQL and Python
‚Ä¢ Background in Econometrics/Economics
‚Ä¢ Data Science modeling experience
‚Ä¢ Excellent speaking and presentation abilities
‚Ä¢ Proactive, driven, and adaptable problem solver
‚Ä¢ Experience with ML/AI algorithm development
‚Ä¢ Understanding of risk management and financial modeling preferred

=== Benefits ===
‚Ä¢ Remote work within Canada
‚Ä¢ Work on cutting-edge ML/AI projects
‚Ä¢ Collaboration with Moody's Analytics
‚Ä¢ Exposure to financial services and risk management
